intro: Xanthoxerampellia acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved xanthoxerine, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and伞形花序 (umbellate inflorescence). The plant features finely divided, acute leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Xanthoxerampellia acutifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
